results.title: Aircraft at work
results.creator_credit: Donald Crosbie, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows various uses of air transport in Australian conditions, with some scenes of historic incidents in Australian aviation. Designed for use in schools.

results.title: After Cook
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A look at the Australian people, their character, attitudes, and way of life. Australians, in the city and the bush, are examined both at home and while enjoying their favourite pastimes. Note: A short version of 28 minutes, intended mainly for overseas viewers, was also produced, entitled ‘Everything under the sun. Commentator: John Meillon.

results.title: Adelaide advances
results.creator_credit: Carl Kayser, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Auster Films
results.brief_description: A description of the city and suburbs of Adelaide since foundation. A father is driving his son to one of the research laboratories and as they approach the city, he tells the boy of local industries and the contributions made to the South Australian economy by the Agricultural Research Institute. Includes scenes of the landmarks of the city and a visit to the Onkaparinga Racecourse. Sponsored by the Australian News & Information Bureau and narrated by David Low.

results.title: Action in Vietnam
results.creator_credit: John Abbott, Frank Bagnall and Department of the Army
results.brief_description: Scenes of the Australian Army First Battalion in South Vietnam. Shows part of a search and destroy mission in War Zone D. Also shows Vietnam under attack and the setting up of a medical post in a village. Narrated by Max Meldrum.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Abbott, Frank Bagnall and Department of the Army

results.title: Across the frontiers
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Stanley Hawes and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film was made at the invitation of the United Nations Organisation to illustrate the part played by Australia in a UNESCO campaign to foster better understanding between nations. Technical advances have broken down the old barriers to knowledge, but there still remain the barriers in men’s minds. The film illustrates the work being done by UNESCO in breaking down these remaining barriers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shan Benson, Stanley Hawes and Australian National Film Board

results.title: About horses
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Machinery has replaced the horse in the field of light transport, and has invaded the medium and heavy traction and transport fields, but in the Australian outback there are jobs that only a horse can do. This film shows the types of horses bred in Australia from the heavy draught to the race-horse and the circus pony.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Thompson and Australian news and Information Bureau

This film shows the types of horses bred in Australia from the heavy draught to the race-horse and the circus pony.

results.title: Aboriginal Education
results.creator_credit: John Sullivan, Ross Campbell and AVEC Film
results.brief_description: A survey of the progress made in Aboriginal education in Victoria in 1976. Shows the wide variety of educational courses operating and encourages communities in different areas to set up their own courses. Also presents the teaching of Aboriginal culture in primary schools and reasons Aborigines get involved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Sullivan, Ross Campbell and AVEC Film

results.title: 11 Steps to Survival
results.creator_credit: Pierre L'Amare, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film demonstrating steps to take in the event of a nuclear attack. Animated drawings show the effects of atomic explosions in the air and at ground level. How wide an area is affected by light and heat flash, radiation and radio-active fall-out is clearly illustrated. How to build or improvise a fall-out shelter, what to stock in it, when to take shelter and how long to stay there are similarly explained.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pierre L’Amare, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: From Melville to Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Tristan Mungatopi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Growing up in two worlds allows me to give back to my community. Tristan Mungatopi, a young Tiwi man’s search for identity and connection.
